The capacity of individuals, groups, and communities to adapt and transform in the face of biological invasions, leveraging emergent relationships, institutional frameworks, and coping mechanisms to mitigate social impacts and learn to coexist with invasive species, while enhancing long-term viability and sustainability.

The vulnerability of individuals or groups to unpredictable or uncontrolled events that disrupt their relationships, livelihoods, and sense of community, ultimately threatening their ability to adapt and thrive in the face of environmental or ecological changes.
